title: Honoring Marguerite Maurer upon the occasion of her retirement after many years of distinguished service to Catholic education
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring Marguerite Maurer upon the occasion of
her retirement after many years of  distinguished  service  to  Catholic
education

WHEREAS,  New  York State's commitment to education is unparalleled; its
history and stature are secured by the superlative caliber of its educa-
tional professionals and the students they inspire; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to  acknowledge  the
significant milestones in the distinguished careers of those outstanding
educational leaders, whose dedication and achievements have been instru-
mental  in  developing  character  and  academic excellence in the young
people of New York State; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions,  this  Legislative  Body  is justly proud to honor
Marguerite Maurer upon the occasion of her retirement after  many  years
of  distinguished  service  to  Catholic education to be celebrated at a
dinner on Wednesday, October 20, 2010, at The Beeches Restaurant,  Rome,
New York; and
  WHEREAS, Marguerite Lupica Maurer, daughter of Charles and Laura Lupi-
ca,  is  a  native  Roman; she graduated from Saint Aloysius Academy and
went on to receive a Bachelor of Arts degree from Utica College as  well
as a Master's degree from Syracuse University; she took additional grad-
uate  education  at St. Rose College and the State University at Oswego;
and
  WHEREAS, Marguerite Maurer has experience teaching  in  a  variety  of
venues;  while  her  husband,  Joseph Maurer served in the United States
Army in Germany, she taught in the Department of  Defense  Schools;  she
has also taught in the Department of Corrections system and the New York
Department of Development; and
  WHEREAS,  Furthermore,  this  outstanding woman has taught in the Rome
City School District; all this while she  and  her  husband  raised  two
wonderful  children,  Marie  and Joe, both of whom are graduates of Rome
Catholic Schools; they are also proud of their two grandchildren,  Ceci-
lia and Patrick; and
  WHEREAS,  Marguerite  Maurer  then went on to what has become her life
work, teaching in the Catholic Schools; she devoted 30 years to teaching
in the Rome Catholic School System; and
  WHEREAS, As a  dedicated  Catholic  educator,  Marguerite  Maurer  was
influential in the lives of thousands of students; two nominated her for
the Rome College Foundation "Most Influential Educator Award"; and
  WHEREAS,  Marguerite Maurer mentored several winners in the "Daughters
of the American Revolution (DAR) Essay Contest"; this past school  year,
two of her students won the DAR Award at both the State and the national
level;  Marguerite also mentored a student who won the National Baseball
Hall of Fame Essay contest; this experience gave the student  the  moti-
vation and confidence to become a teacher; and
  WHEREAS,  She organized and chaired a public speaking contest honoring
the achievements of women; the Board Members  of  the  National  Women's
Hall  of Fame participated in this event giving her students an opportu-
nity to interact with leadership at a national level; and
  WHEREAS,  This  exceptional  educator  developed  a  public   speaking
program,  sponsored by the Rome American Legion; the theme of the annual
contest was always patriotism and devotion to our Nation and  God;  this
again,  provided her students the opportunity to interact with community
leaders; and
  WHEREAS, Educators like Marguerite Maurer provide a tremendous service
to the future of our State and Nation, inspiring  generations  of  young

people in their educational journeys and ensuring their success in their
future years; and
  WHEREAS,  Marguerite  Maurer has clearly had an enduring impact on the
youth of the Rome Catholic School System, as well as on  the  community-
at-large,  and  accordingly  merits  recognition  and  applause  for her
impressive dedication to others; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  to  commend  the
efforts  of those individuals who work to support our proud tradition of
public education by providing their skills and talents to  our  schools;
now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Marguerite Maurer upon the occasion of her retirement  after  many
years  of  distinguished  service  to  Catholic  education,  and for her
significant contributions to education in New York State;  and  to  wish
her continued success in all her future endeavors; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Marguerite Maurer, Rome, New York.
